availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: William Penrose Conner was born in Bath County, Kentucky on August 24, 1828. Parents were John Harrison Conner and Elizabeth Ewing Nichols. Conner served in the Mexican American War, enlisting in 1847. He was the Sheriff of Bath County for three terms ending in 1862. In 1862 he enlisted in the Confederate Army, achieving the rank of Captain. Married July 17, 1855 to Ann Wilson in Bath County, Kentucky. He died on August 10, 1910 in Bath County, Kentucky. He is buried in Owingsville Cemetery.

bibl.p:
"Obituary," Owingsville Outlook, August 18, 1910, http://kdl.kyvl.org/catalog/xt773n20dc4f1; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 2nd Division; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville; _Find A Grave, "Capt William Penrose Conner( August 24, 1828 -
August 10, 1910)," Memorial #94165734, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=94165734&ref=acom (accessed June 27, 2017).
